p: We also aimed at identifying the potential toxicity of our extracts in larvae (from 3 to 5 dpf). At 3 dpf, zebrafish larvae exhibit functional livers and kidneys, suggesting the possible metabolism of several compounds [ 59, 60]. Interestingly, the study of the toxicity of polyphenols-rich acetonic and aqueous extracts from A. borbonica in zebrafish larvae from 3 to 5 dpf revealed no significant differences in the median lethal concentrations between the larvae and embryos, with 5 ± 0.2 vs. 5.6 ± 0.4 g/L and 17.6 ± 1.7 vs. 20.3 g/L for acetonic and aqueous extracts, respectively.
